Authors

Studium has translated original material from a variety of authors who originally published in Latin or German. In many cases, contributors have prepared brief biographies of the most prominent authors in our catalog.

The complete list of original authors is below. Click any author's card to visit a page with biographical details and a list of all works from that author.

Jakob Andreae
1528–1590
Johannes Brenz
1499–1570
Martin Chemnitz
1522–1586
David Chytraeus
1531–1600
Franz Pieper
1852–1931
Johann Gerhard
1583–1637
Matthias Hafenreffer
1561–1619
Jacob Heerbrand
1521–1600
Adolf Hoenecke
1835–1908
David Hollaz
1648–1713
Carl Manthey-Zorn
1846–1928
Balthasar Mentzer
1565–1627
August Pieper
1857–1946
Johannes Andreas Quenstedt
1528–1590
Nikolaus Selnecker
1530–1592
Albert Siegler
c. 1839–??
George Stoeckhardt
1842–1913
Sigmund von Birken
1626–1681
C.F.W. Walther
1811–1887

Studium is published under the supervision of Martin Luther College, New Ulm, Minnesota.
